tituloHeroSection: Revolutionize your interconnection processes with our Centralized Locking
subtituloHeroSection: Checkbank¬Æ offers cutting-edge technology for the centralized processing of large-volume transactions. It facilitates the electronic transfer and clearing of funds between banks, handling intensive workloads and scalable data. Its mission-critical systems require high performance under international standards and include innovative payment solutions such as ATMs, Interbank Mobile Payments (P2P), Person-to-Merchant (P2C/C2P), eCommerce Payments, and Supplier Payments, among others.
titleSectionTwo: ¬øWhy is it important to automate and centralize the operations and processes of interconnected banks?
subTitleSectionTwo: Automatizing and centralizing the operations and processes of interconnected banks is crucial because it guarantees safe and reliable communication between them. This, in turn, facilitates various essential interbank activities such as fund transfers, compensation and liquidation. In addition, it provides a standardized framework for interbank connectivity, which is essential for regulatory compliance.
columOneTwoSectionTwoSubtitle: Manual processes that consume hours of specialized work daily.
columOneThreeSectionTwosubtitle: Frequent errors in centralized bank closing lead to commission errors and discomfort for affiliated banks and customers.
columOneFourSectionTwoSubtitle: Complexity in generating accurate reports that comply with local and international regulations.
columFiveSectionTwoSubtitle: Late generation of reports that affects strategic decision-making.
columTwoOneSectionTwoSubTile: Ensures the integrity and consistency of financial data across all affiliated banks and interconnected networks.
columTwoTwoSectionTwoTitle: Reconciliation of financial transactions in real time or in batches.
columTwoTwoSectionTwoSubTile: Ensures automatic and accurate reconciliation of transactions between interconnected banks and networks, identifying potential claims and optimizing the ability to clear funds and assets, ensuring liquidity is available when needed.
columTwoThreeSectionTwoSubTile: It guarantees automatic and accurate reconciliation between interconnected banks. The ability to settle funds and assets ensures liquidity is available when needed.
columTwoFourSectionTwoSubTile: Standardized protocols and formats, ensuring compatibility and interoperability between different banks and financial systems.
columTwoFiveSectionTwoSubTile: Maintain financial accuracy with daily validations and balances. Minimize the risk of errors or disputes, further reducing the potential costs arising from such incidents.
columTwoSixSectionTwoTitle: Strengthens the stability and overall confidence of the national banking system
columTwoSixSectionTwoSubTile: By strengthening the stability of the national banking system, an enabling environment for foreign investment is fostered, sustained economic growth is stimulated, and the protection of citizens' savings is guaranteed..
columTwoSevenSectionTwoSubTile: Without a common infrastructure that allows for secure and efficient communication between participating institutions, regardless of their individual systems or protocols.
columTwoEightSectionTwoSubTile: It does not use standardized messaging protocols and formats, and does not guarantee compatibility and interoperability between participating institutions.
columTwoNineSectionTwoSubTile: Integration with fintech companies. Designed to adapt to the growing needs of the financial industry.

titleSectionTwoFour: Technology Proven in the Banking Sector
subtitleSectionTwoFour: Our platform is installed in the country's second-largest banking network, with five (5) major interconnected banks. Its architecture supports a growing transaction volume without compromising data speed and reliability, with processing power, alerts, demanding mission-critical tasks, and robust security.

features.title: Main benefits
features.subtitle: Discover the main benefits that make our solution unique and powerful.

feature1.title: üíæ Native Integration with IBM i (AS/400) Systems
feature1.description: Works directly on your existing infrastructure without data migration or changes to your current environment.

feature2.title: üìã Confidence and stability in the financial system
feature2.description: The main objective of the process is to ensure the integrity and consistency of financial information at the systemic level. The central bank plays a fundamental role in supervising the settlement system and ensuring financial stability. The integrity of the financial system remains intact.

feature3.title: üõ°Ô∏è Reducing operational risk
feature3.description: The system is a critical process that ensures the accuracy of all transactions and balances. In the event of discrepancies, a process is initiated to investigate and resolve them.

feature4.title: üë• Protection of assets and data
feature4.description: Cybersecurity is a top priority to protect the information and funds handled. All transactional and closing data is also backed up to ensure recovery in the event of a failure.

feature5.title: üìä Transaction efficiency
feature5.description: The netting process nets transactions between banks to calculate net balances payable or receivable, reducing the number of individual transfers. Real-time settlement (LBTR) system settle transactions instantly.

feature6.title: üîÑ Transparency and reliability
feature6.description: Both the centralized system and each bank generate closing reports summarizing the day's activity, final balances, and adjustments made. These reports are crucial for accounting and auditing purposes.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: We resolve the most common doubts about our Centralized Banking Closing System
faq.question1: Does the system require data migration?
faq.answer1: No, it is designed to operate within your existing AS/400 environment without affecting your current infrastructure. The system natively integrates with your current databases and applications, allowing for an implementation that does not interrupt your daily operations.
faq.question2: Is it compatible with any version of IBM i?
faq.answer2: Yes, it works with the most commonly used versions, starting from version 7.2 onwards. Our system has been tested and certified to work with all current IBM i versions, including the latest updates and security patches.
faq.question3: Do you offer technical support after implementation?
faq.answer3: Of course, we have a specialized team available 24/7 to resolve any incidents. Our support includes proactive monitoring, automatic updates, preventive maintenance, and direct access to engineers specialized in banking systems.
faq.question4: How long does the implementation take?
faq.answer4: It depends on the size of the bank, but on average between 30 and 60 days. This time includes: initial analysis, custom configuration, configuration migration, exhaustive testing, staff training, and production deployment. We guarantee a seamless transition.
faq.question5: Can the Central Locking be processed more than once a day?
faq.answer5: If the system is capable of receiving any number of transactions and applying the reconciliation and settlement process in the central bank at any time of day and as many times as the user requires.
faq.question6: Are there control reports that the user can customize according to their operational requirements?
faq.answer6: The system includes a series of predefined reports for general accounting and statistics. However, since each organization has a unique operational process, users have the option to request additional reports and queries to be included in the system, based on their specific operational needs.
faq.question7: Are there repositories of the operations processed in previous days?
faq.answer7: The system allows you to view detailed transaction history up to six months old.
